children.title: Square roots

children.description:
Roots are nice, but we prefer dealing with regular numbers as much as
possible. So, for example, instead of √4 we prefer dealing with 2. What about
roots that aren't equal to an integer, like √20? Still, we can write 20 as 4⋅5
and then use known properties to write √(4⋅5) as √4⋅√5, which is 2√5\. We
*simplified* √20.

example, 2x+3y=5 is a linear equation in standard form. When an equation is

form is also very useful when solving systems of two linear equations.
